pros: If you have a doctorate you can teach here
cons: Must have a doctorate to teach here
The salary scale was low for non-exempt staff

pros: I have always worked at a university or college and enjoy working with students.
cons: The president, upper management and faculty treat their staff like garbage. They preach love, light but are far from it. Admins are talked to like peons.

job_title: Director of Simulation Lab in Louisville, KY
pros: Small student population run be the catholic church.
cons: No budget to improve and keep up with technology. Could be an amazing lab.

job_title: Director, Clinical Education in Louisville, KY
pros: small community of students and faculty
cons: limited support from administration for development

pros: There are no Pros at all!
cons: Poor Communications/ don't take care of employees

job_title: Part Time Adjunct Instructor in Louisville, KY
pros: The students were fine although often very unprepared for college.
cons: The Humanities Department admin is full of incompetency. They don't like it when an employee is better prepared and gets better student evaluations than they do. So, they get rid of you. Also, the pay is less than working at Wendy's.

job_title: Assistant Professor/Lab Director in Louisville, KY
pros: Small university which fulfills community needs for compassionate admissions of a diverse student body that is growing in size and reputation.  It is a great school that instills love for the work of education.
cons: Some resources are limited, workload is heavy with a small faculty body, multiple jobs are assigned to limited people, and long hours are common.  After a day at work, one might be tired, despite remaining committed to the effort.

review_title: Spalding is a great place to work.
pros: I work in the athletic dept. part time. I've had a great experience there, management and staff genuinely care about you and want you to succeed. They are open to new ideas and ways to help the school stand out. Fun place to work and lots of internal opportunities. They are also very flexible and want you to have a health work/life balance.

job_title: Director of Continuing Studies in Louisville, KY
pros: I feel aligned with the mission of this school, to bring quality art education to underserved students.  The culture at Spalding University, the 'parent' institution, is ethical and kind.  I enjoyed co-workers who were inspiring and warm.
cons: The school is young and straining to gain traction.  My program was not funded.

pros: Get freedom and independence to craft classes as instructor sees fit....small class size.....nice staff....
cons: Classes are set up into 6 week sessions....makes for very little time for learning subject matter

pros: I was able to participate in the work study program which really helped out with paying for school and getting work done while managing the weight room.
cons: No complaints. Would recommend work study though!

pros: Great support system, wonderful and talented staff on board!
cons: Campus is downtown and sometimes room for Parking is a problem. and is located in and up and coming part of town

pros: The University is full of compassion and treat all their students, staff with dignity.
cons: The University did not have any down falls that I seen.
